forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 25. Southwest wind around 8 mph.

forecast.name: Christmas Day
forecast.shortForecast: Isolated Snow Showers then Mostly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: Isolated snow showers between 7am and 10am, then isolated rain and snow showers between 10am and noon. Mostly cloudy. High near 40, with temperatures falling to around 31 in the afternoon. West wind 9 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
In the early hours of Christmas Day, Boston lies beneath a canopy of dense clouds, the faint chill of twenty-five degrees settling into the bones. Wisps of chilly wind whisper their tale, brushing against the city, stirring the remnants of holiday excitement. As daylight breaks, the forecast teases with the promise of isolated snow showers, hinting at a whimsical transformation of the drab winter landscape. Yet, even as flakes may dance through the morning light, an undercurrent of rain threatens to shift the scene to something muddier. With a high near forty, the temperatures will descend as the day progresses, forcing the layers on our bodies to adapt, matching the day’s oscillating moods.

Wrapped in warmth, one might don a sturdy coat against the bite of the wind and support it with a scarf to fend off any rogue chills. A snug pair of gloves would serve well when the moment calls for feasting on a warm coffee or hot chocolate while tucked into a corner café, relishing the subtle hum of holiday chatter around you. The inviting aroma of freshly baked goods wafting through the air has an appeal all its own, suggesting a good moment to pause and simply be. As the snowflakes tease the day, consider a brisk walk through the quieter streets, where the hushed sounds of the city mingle with the fleeting beauty of the season, or perhaps admire how holiday lights reflect upon the wet pavement, caught in the company of soft winter shadows.
